meanings.definition: To come upon after losing something and searching for it.
examples: Alex found his father's lost watch.

images.alt: Photo of a father and daughter reading a book.
images.description: A father and daughter reading a book.
images.caption: This child is finding hidden objects in this popup book.

source.title: Dad and Daughter Reading a Cutouts Fairy Tale Book
source.author: cottonbro

meanings.definition: Marked by careful thinking or consideration.
examples: They have to seriously consider what will result from their actions.

meanings.definition: A place where a group of people come to settle which is under the control of their home country.
examples: America was a colony of England before it became independent.

meanings.definition: To bargain or come to an agreement with another person.
examples: If the price is too high, try negotiating with the seller.

meanings.definition: A person who acts as an agent or mediator between persons, groups, or the like; go-between.
examples: Pocahontas was an intermediary between the Algonquian people and the English colonists.

images.description: One person talks to two other people.
images.caption: This intermediary talks with two other people, explaining each person's point of view.

meanings.definition: A place where a group of people come to settle which is under the control of their home country.
examples: America was a colony of England before it became independent.

meanings.definition: To bargain or come to an agreement with another person.
examples: If the price is too high, offer a lower price and see if the owner will settle for it.

meanings.definition: A person who acts as an agent or mediator between persons, groups, or the like; go-between.
examples: Pocahontas was an negotiator between the Algonquian people and the English colonists.

images.description: One person talks to two other people.
images.caption: This negotiator talks with two other people, explaining each person's point of view.

examples: Alex observed where his father's left his watch.

images.alt: Photo of a father and daughter reading a book.
images.description: A father and daughter reading a book.
images.caption: This child is observing and discovering hidden objects in this popup book.

source.title: Dad and Daughter Reading a Cutouts Fairy Tale Book
source.author: cottonbro

meanings.definition: Marked by careful thinking or consideration.
examples: They have to gravely consider what will result from their thoughtless actions.

meanings.definition: A place where a group of people come to settle which is under the control of their home country.
examples: Jamestown was a township in Virginia, an early colony of England in America.

meanings.definition: To bargain or come to an agreement with another person.
examples: If the price is too high, try compromising on a lower price with the seller.

meanings.definition: A person who arrived not long ago.
examples: The family just moved in and are newcomers to the neighborhood.

images.alt: Photo of man and child holding a newborn baby.
images.description: A man, wearing a mask and hair covering, and young child hold a newborn baby. The baby is wrapped in a white blanket, has its eyes closed and its mouth open.
images.caption: This newborn baby is a newcomer to the family.

meanings.definition: A group of people, families, or villages that share the same language, social customs, and ancestors.
examples: She left her tribe to go explore the world.

images.alt: Photo of a group of men from the same tribe.
images.description: A group of men standing together. The men are dressed in similar clothing. They wear sandals and large, bright, loosely draped cloth around their shoulders and bodies.
images.caption: Men from a tribe gathered together.

source.title: Photo of Group of Men Wearing Assorted Scarves Holding Sticks
source.author: Follow Alice

meanings.definition: A person who lives in or is a member of a new settlement or colony.
examples: John Smith was one of the English colonists in Virginia.
I could feel the tension in the exam room.

meanings.definition: Someone who takes or holds someone or something else captive.
examples: The prisoners planned their escape from their captors.

images.alt: Photo of a person in handcuffs being held by a person in uniform.
images.description: A person is wearing handcuffs and an orange jumpsuit. Next to this person is a person wearing a dark uniform and a badge. The person in the uniform holds the arm of the person wearing handcuffs.
images.caption: The police officer is the captor, and the person in handcuffs is the captive.

source.title: Man in Orange Jacket Standing Beside Man in Black Leather Jacket
source.author: RODNAE Productions
